kivaworld

Class KeyboardResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • kivaworld.KeyboardResource

  • public class KeyboardResource
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple text scanner that takes keyboard input from a user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeyboardResource()
      Scans the "standard" input stream.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the Scanner object
      java.lang.String getLine()
      This method returns the current input line, excluding any line separator at the end.
      boolean yes(java.lang.String line)
      Returns true if input string begins with a Y or y.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyboardResource

        public KeyboardResource()
        Scans the "standard" input stream. This stream is already open and ready to supply input data. Typically, this stream corresponds to keyboard input.

    • Method Detail

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine()
        This method returns the current input line, excluding any line separator at the end.
        Returns:
        The line of input scanned.

      • yes

        public boolean yes(java.lang.String line)
        Returns true if input string begins with a Y or y. Y, y, yes, yepper, yup, yak and yo-yo will all return true.
        Returns:
        true if input begins with a Y or y

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Scanner object
